Package com.jme.app

Class VRAppState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme.app.state.AbstractAppState
      • com.jme.app.VRAppState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme.app.state.AppState
    public class VRAppState
extends com.jme.app.state.AbstractAppState
    A JMonkey app state dedicated to Virtual Reality. An application that want to use VR devices (HTC vive, ...) has to use this app state.
    As this app state and the main application have to share application settings, the common way to use this app state is:
    • To create application settings and set the VR related settings (see VRConstants).
    • To instantiate this app state with the created settings.
    • To instantiate the main application and to attach it to the created settings (with setSettings(AppSettings)).
    • To start the main application.
    Attaching an instance of this app state to an already started application may cause crashes.
    Author:
    Julien Seinturier - COMEX SA - http://www.seinturier.fr

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean DISABLE_VR
      Is the application has not to start within VR mode (default is false).

        environment - the VR environment that this app state is using.

    • Method Detail

      • simpleUpdate

        public void simpleUpdate​(float tpf)
        Simple update of the app state, this method should contains any spatial updates. This method is called by the update() method and should not be called manually.
        Parameters:
        tpf - the application time.

      • simpleRender

        public void simpleRender​(com.jme.renderer.RenderManager renderManager)

        Parameters:
        renderManager - the render manager.

      • getObserver

        public java.lang.Object getObserver()
        Get the scene observer. If no observer has been set, this method returns the application camera.
        Returns:
        the scene observer.
        See Also:
        setObserver(Spatial)

      • setObserver

        public void setObserver​(com.jme.scene.Spatial observer)
        Set the scene observer. The VR headset will be linked to it. If no observer is set, the VR headset is linked to the application camera.
        Parameters:
        observer - the scene observer.
